template.template: Template Futur Tech OS Linux - Custix - Active Agent
template.name: Template Futur Tech OS Linux - Custix - Active Agent

item.name: [OS] Kernel: Maximum number of opened files
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

trigger.name: OS: Configured max number of opened files is too low

item.name: [OS] Kernel: Maximum number of processes
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

trigger.name: OS: Configured max number of processes is too low

item.name: [OS] Processes: Number of running processes
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: [OS] Processes: Number of processes
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

item.name: Processor load (1 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

trigger.name: OS: Processor load is too high

item.name: Processor load (5 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (15 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: [OS] CPU: $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: [OS] CPU: $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: [OS] CPU: $2 time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

trigger.name: OS: Disk I/O is overloaded
trigger.description: OS spends significant time waiting for I/O (input/output) operations. It could be indicator of performance issues with storage system.

item.name: [OS] CPU: $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: [OS] CPU: $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: [OS] CPU: $2 time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: [OS] CPU: $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: [OS] CPU: $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

trigger.name: OS: Swap - Lack of free space
trigger.description: It probably means that the systems requires more physical memory.

item.name: [OS] System: Information
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

trigger.name: OS: System has just been restarted

item.name: [OS] Users: Number of logged
item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

item.name: [OS] Memory: Available
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item_prototype.name: [Custix] Disk '{#NAME}': Stats - In Flight
item_prototype.description: Number of I/Os currently in flight (requests)

item_prototype.name: [Custix] Disk '{#NAME}': Stats - IO Ticks
item_prototype.description: Total time this block device has been active (milliseconds)

item_prototype.name: [Custix] Disk '{#NAME}': Stats - Read - Merges
item_prototype.description: Number of read I/Os merged with in-queue I/O (requests)

item_prototype.name: [Custix] Disk '{#NAME}': Stats - Read - Ticks
item_prototype.description: Total wait time for read requests (milliseconds)

item_prototype.name: [Custix] Disk '{#NAME}': Stats - Time in Queue
item_prototype.description: Total wait time for all requests (milliseconds)

item_prototype.name: [Custix] Disk '{#NAME}': Stats - Write - Merges
item_prototype.description: Number of write I/Os merged with in-queue I/O (requests)

item_prototype.name: [Custix] Disk '{#NAME}': Stats - Write - Ticks
item_prototype.description: Total wait time for write requests (milliseconds)

discovery_rule.name: [OS] Discovery: Network interface
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of network interfaces as defined in global regular expression "Network interfaces for discovery".

item.host: Template Futur Tech OS Linux - Custix - Active Agent
Template Futur Tech OS Linux - Custix - Active Agent

discovery_rule.name: [OS] Discovery: Mounted filesystem
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types as defined in global regular expression "File systems for discovery".

trigger_prototype.name: Free inodes is less than {$FS_INODE_CRIT}% on volume {#FSNAME}
Free inodes is less than {$FS_INODE_WARN}% on volume {#FSNAME}

dependency.name: Free inodes is less than {$FS_INODE_CRIT}% on volume {#FSNAME}
dependency.expression: {Template Futur Tech OS Linux - Custix - Active Agent:vfs.fs.inode[{#FSNAME}, pused].min(#5)}>{$FS_INODE_CRIT}

trigger_prototype.name: FS: Used disk space is more than {$FS_SPACE_CRIT}% on {#FSNAME}
FS: Used disk space is more than {$FS_SPACE_WARN}% on {#FSNAME}

dependency.name: FS: Used disk space is more than {$FS_SPACE_CRIT}% on {#FSNAME}
